dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.welcomeDesc: ðŸ˜Ž Don't know how to start? Click the button below to start a tutorial.

tutorial.step1: Dashboard is an overview of Chaos Mesh, where you can observe the running status of all experiments.
tutorial.step2: Experiments manages all experiments, where you can perform various operations (pause, archive, update, etc.) on the experiment.
tutorial.step3: Events shows the events generated by all experiments.
tutorial.step5: You can start your first experiment from here.~
tutorial.step6: Or click here to create a new experiment at any time.
tutorial.step7: Search provides multiple syntaxes to help you locate experiments or events quickly. You can try it after creating an experiment.
tutorial.step8: Here you can browse the respective experiments, events and archives by selecting different namespaces.
tutorial.step9: Predefined can store custom experiments for quick execution in the future.
tutorial.step10: ðŸŽ‰ Congratulations on completing all the tutorial steps! Click the blank space to exit.

dashboard.veteranDesc: ðŸ§¨ Start with a new experiment! After it's successfully created, you can return the dashboard to observe its status.
dashboard.predefinedDesc: ðŸ“¦ Store custom experiments here for quick execution.

common.isKVHelperText: Type key:value and end with a space to generate a key/value pair

tip.title: The following search syntax can help to locate the events, experiments and archives quickly:
tip.namespace: namespace:default xxx will search for events, experiments and archives with namespace default
tip.kind: kind:NetworkChaos xxx will search for events, experiments and archives with kind NetworkChaos, you can also type kind:net because the search is fuzzy
tip.pod: pod:echoserver-774cdcc8b6-nrm65 will search for events by affected pod
tip.ip: ip:172.17.0.6 is similar to pod:xxx, filter by pod IP
tip.uuid: uuid:2f79a4d6-1952-45b5-b2d5-ce715823c7a7 will search for events, experiments and archives by experimental uuid
